image.altText: Convicted child sex offender Allan Hopkins.

props.synopsis: Police are calling for public assistance after a convicted child rapist who is facing new serious sex offence allegations, has fled South Australia.

title.children: SA, QLD police search for convicted child rapist accused of new serious sex offence

image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on her head.

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court of South Australia grants Anastasia Narelle Marshall — who is accused of killing her ex-wife, Krystal Marshall — bail with strict conditions.

title.children: Woman accused of murdering SA mother Krystal Marshall granted bail

image.altText: A man and woman hold a framed photo of their daughter

props.synopsis: Australia records its highest number of asthma deaths in a decade but a peak body says there are no straight answers as to why there has been an increase or why women like Ashleigh Young are more vulnerable.

title.children: Ashleigh was a sporty woman with an 'infectious' laugh. But asthma cut her life short and left her family heartbroken

image.altText: A white teenage boy with fair hair and Down syndrome sitting on the ground

props.synopsis: Remembering their son Finlay brings smiles to his parents' faces — but the pain of losing him to what they believe was a preventable death is undeniable.

title.children: 'Kick in the guts': The death certificate detail that made the loss of Finlay Browne even more painful

image.altText: Bruce looks serious as he walks through a throng of reporters, wearing suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has ordered Bruce Lehrmann to pay Network Ten's costs in defending his failed defamation case over an interview with Brittany Higgins on The Project.

title.children: 'No real winners': Bruce Lehrmann ordered to pay Network Ten's costs over failed defamation case

image.altText: Photo illustration of Bruce Lehrmann with wood panelling and Australian emblem of Federal Court in Sydney in the background.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders Bruce Lehrmann to pay Network Ten’s costs of defending his failed defamation case over the interview with Brittany Higgins on The Project.

title.children: Judge finds Lehrmann should pay costs 'on an indemnity basis' for most of defamation case

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The critical issue in Justice Lee's decision
Network wins costs on an indemnity basis

image.altText: The High Court on the shores of Lake Burley Griffin. There are dark clouds over the building, and a seagull in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The High Court dismisses a case brought by an Iranian man demanding to be released from immigration detention after refusing to cooperate with efforts to deport him.

title.children: High Court sides with government in case of Iranian man resisting deportation

image.altText: An aerial view of the plant with numerous chimneys and steam coming out of them

props.synopsis: The boss of Orica, a major explosives manufacturer that relies on gas, says the federal government's gas strategy won't assist what remains of Australia's manufacturing industry unless it caps prices at globally competitive levels.

title.children: Australia is a major gas exporter, but it's cheaper for this local manufacturer to get it in the US

image.altText: Baby Bob Hawke in a tin bath in the backyard of his Bordertown home.

props.synopsis: Mr Hawke's former home in South Australia has been renovated as a bed and breakfast, with themes based on the ex-PM's life and family. But not everyone in Bordertown is a fan of the Labor luminary.

title.children: 'Some people have reservations': Bob Hawke's childhood home honours Labor icon in Liberal heartland

image.altText: Matthew Dickerson speaking in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: The alleged incident occurred during a karaoke afterparty involving Japanese officials from the town of Minokamo and a visiting delegation from the New South Wales town of Dubbo.

title.children: 'I was drunk': Japanese official accused of inappropriate behaviour to visiting daughter of Australian mayor

image.altText: A photo of a person in an online meeting with the person's head is blurred.

props.synopsis: The ANU has promised to take swift action if an investigation finds Nazi gestures were used at an online students' association meeting this week.

title.children: Australian National University investigating if Nazi gestures were used at student association meeting

image.altText: A still from a video showing a confrontation between two men standing up as others watch on.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers a series of allegations by former workers blowing the whistle on mistreatment, neglect and excessive use of force against people with disabilities being cared for by NDIS provider Evolution Support Services.

title.children: Jake's support worker tells him to settle down. Seconds later, there's a sickening crack and a cry of pain

image.altText: close up of side of Scott Morrison's face

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison said he wanted a woman to replace him in the very safe seat of Cook. What happened instead has been described as "blatant, arrogant and overt" — a concerted campaign driven by some of the country's most influential figures.

title.children: A prime minister's seat up for grabs, the backlash in the battle for Cook

image.altText: Map of the Great Artesian Basin

props.synopsis: Accused by the Nationals of making a wrong call over a controversial carbon capture project, Liberal deputy leader Sussan Ley hits back, exposing a split at the highest levels of the Coalition.

title.children: Politicians are running a mile from a controversial carbon project that Gina Rinehart wants stopped

image.altText: Two men stand together with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: Disappearances are not uncommon in Mexico. But in their haste to close the case of murdered surfers Jake and Callum Robinson and Carter Rhoad, local authorities leave a lot of questions unanswered.

title.children: 'The hallmarks of organised crime': What we don't know about the murder of two brothers in Mexico

image.altText: Sakshi Agrawal wearing a white suit holding a phone to her ear.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne driver who fled the scene after hitting a woman boarding a tram and later blamed the crash on her Tesla's autopilot feature has been jailed.

title.children: Driver who panicked and fled after hitting pedestrian boarding tram jailed by Victorian court

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks at a microphone with an American flag behind him.

props.synopsis: As the US president threatens to pull back on his support for Israel, his election opponent makes headlines for very different reasons as Stormy Daniels appears in court.

title.children: Biden's red line, Trump's make-or-break moment and a brain worm: US politics takes some unusual turns

image.altText: A young girl is silhouetted against fading evening sun holding a football in one hand while walking across sand dune ridge

props.synopsis: In the shadow of Uluru, an unprecedented football carnival was quietly held for young First Nations women from remote communities. More than sport was at play.

title.children: Hidden from view, a remarkable football carnival took place near Uluru

image.altText: Two purple and white planes on a tarmac, seen through a chainlink fence.

props.synopsis: Administrators say up to 20 parties are interested in saving the embattled airline as large debts are revealed at the first creditors' meeting.

title.children: Bonza administrators tell creditors they are hopeful airline can be saved despite $116m debt

image.altText: A composite image of the rappers Kendrick and Drake both rapping into microphones.

props.synopsis: Kendrick Lamar and Drake's intense feud risks commodifying and objectifying black people, argues hip-hop scholar.

title.children: 'Folks are absolutely just looking for blood': Who wins when rappers fight?

image.altText: Two video stills from a young boy wearing a cap, on the top left side is a screenshot of his Instagram follower count.

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old from Kenya has taken the social media world by storm – simply by being the guy who claps the most. And along the way, he's picked up more than 250,000 followers on Instagram. But can he make it to a million?

title.children: We know clapping can make you happy. But can it make you famous?

image.altText: A composite image of Zendaya wearing a large flower hat, a French baker with a baguette and Stormy Daniels.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Met Gala, Stormy Daniels testifies and the world's longest baguette

image.altText: An older man in a coat speaks into a microphone on marble steps in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Robert F Kennedy Jr struggled with memory loss and brain fog so severe his friends were concerned he had a tumour. Instead, he says, doctors found a parasite.

title.children: Robert F Kennedy says a worm 'ate a portion' of his brain, 'then died'. What can a brain parasite do?

image.altText: A hand holding a bacterial agar plate is inside a clear screen

props.synopsis: Matthew donates poo to his local stool bank to help treat gut diseases. In the future, faecal transplants may use gut bacteria grown in the lab, not in humans.

title.children: Unlocking the code of the 'super pooper' could usher in new wave of gut health treatments

image.altText: King charles wearing a grey suit and smiling

props.synopsis: The monarch said he was happy to take the opportunity to visit the military school where he engaged with personnel and their families.

title.children: King Charles jokes about being 'allowed out of my cage' as he visits military college

image.altText: Kaleen in a glittery cat-suit wearing knee-high boots and long pony-tail, a dancer behind her, on off to the side

props.synopsis: Semi-final two of the Eurovision song contest has wrapped up and these are the acts who have made it into the grand final.

title.children: Eurovision semi-final two has been sung, and this is who made it through

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is likely to be left millions of dollars in debt as he gets the bill today for his failed defamation action against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann likely to receive bill for millions over failed defamation case

image.altText: Illustration of person in activewear sitting on an exercise ball and holding one hand high into the air, holding dumbbell.

props.synopsis: Weights training isn't just about getting ripped. Building muscles can stave off diseases and improve your quality of life as you age. These experts share ways to do it.

title.children: One in three Australians has pain. Building muscle can help — and you don't need to leave home to do it

image.altText: A bulldozer rips up rows of vines.

props.synopsis: Too much wine might not seem like a problem, but take a drive through Australian wine country and you'll quickly see how a global glut has created a crisis.

title.children: Younger people aren't drinking wine, and there's too much for sale

image.altText: Man holds plate of sushi.

props.synopsis: Japan proposes a plan to allow the hunting of large fin whales around its coast, sparking backlash from environmental groups.

title.children: Japan proposes to start hunting fin whales, reigniting debate over whale meat and cultural traditions

image.altText: A group of people hold up university certificates. All faces are blurred except the man in the middle.

props.synopsis: Artem Vasilyev was working as an electrical engineer for the Department of Defence when raids on his Findon home uncovered firearms and substances used to make explosives, a jury has been told.

title.children: Terror plot accused had guns, chemicals and extremist material, court hears

image.altText: A man in a white t-shirt stands in front of a group of tents.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian activists camping at the University of Adelaide say fireworks scorched tents when they were let off around their campsite.

title.children: 'Cowardly tactic': Fireworks thrown at university protest camp

image.altText: Troy SMith

props.synopsis: Bali authorities confirm an Australian man has been arrested and charged with drug offences.

title.children: Australian man arrested and charged for alleged drug offences in Bali

image.altText: Coffs creek walkway facing east

props.synopsis: Police have ramped up patrols in Coffs Harbour after a 45-year-old woman was attacked on a popular walking track, just days after the region was rocked by a murder and a violent robbery.

title.children: Woman bashed, left unconscious beside walkway in third violent attack in a week in coastal city

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Bank of England holds interest rates steady but the governor is "optimistic" about interest rate cuts while US indices lift, continuing a strong run. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street keeps lifting, Bank of England holds rates steady and ASX up

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Monetary policy is 'poised,' household incomes will recover, but interest rates will be higher in the future
The world is drinking less wine, and decades-old vines are being torn up
Bonza founder apologises for airline's collapse
